greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, rows = inverse binomial transforms of A073133 columns.
comment: Left border of the triangle = Fibonacci numbers, right border = factorials. Companion triangle A117937 is generated from Lucas polynomials, using analogous operations.
Note that binomial transforms are defined from offset 1 here. - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 16 2019
formula: Inverse binomial transforms of A073133 columns. Such columns are f(x), Fibonacci polynomials.
example: Inverse binomial transforms of the foregoing columns generates the triangle rows:
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 01 2020, from Maple *)
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 03 2006
